Yeah I hadnt heard of it until today. I just looked at him and said glad he=
s alive and thanks for the info I find the 7 thing interesting.
=A0
Ive had=
 spirits say they were seven before when I asked what it was they always le=
ad me to the conclusion it was a label for the group speaking this info jus=
t made me go hmmm then wow once it sunk in. Interesting synchronicity anywa=
y.
=A0
Misty

--- On Mon, 5/11/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@...> wrote:

 interesting tidbit of info

I guess police still use those codes. Emergency a=
gencies such as ESDA now follow the FEMA Incident Command System/National I=
ncident Management System=A0which requires all=A0communications to be in pl=
ain English (no codes).

Zack

=A0
On Sun, May 10, 2009 at 11:31 PM, Misty =
Dawn <bulletbabea@ yahoo.com> wrote:













Tonight at work I was tal=
king to a state trooper, there had been an accident. I asked him if there w=
ere any deaths (it was very very bad) and he said he didnt know so he got o=
n his radio and called in and asked them if it was a 7 at the site. They to=
ld him negative, and he told me the little boy who was the worst off was st=
ill alive. I asked him why did you ask them if it was a 7. He said code 7, =
I was asking them if they were dead. So if you ever hear anyone call 7 over=
 the radio that means someones dead.
=A0
Just thought I would pass that on.=
 I find it interesting since I know alot of us have heard this before when =
used to describe who is speaking rather than a name they say seven.
=A0
Mis=
ty
